intro: Impatiens nzoana subsp. nzoana, commonly known as the Nzoana impatiens, is a flowering plant native to the Eastern Arc Mountains of Tanzania. It is characterized by its erect growth habit and produces showy, funnel-shaped flowers in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded forest understories and has lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It belongs to the Balsaminaceae family and is valued for its ornamental appeal in horticulture. Due to habitat loss, it is also considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
